intro: Icica enneandra, commonly known as the golden bell orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The flowering period occurs during the warmer months, making it a popular ornamental plant in botanical gardens and private collections.
